summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York daily log for August 10, 2019, documenting the shift activities and the medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a hospital.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 who was found unresponsive in his cell (206-220) in Unit 9 South. CPR was performed, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The lieutenant who assumed duties as the Morning Watch Operations Lieutenant at the beginning of the log and was later relieved at approximately 5:30 AM.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The lieutenant who assumed duties as the Evening Watch Operations Lieutenant at 4:00 PM and was later relieved at midnight.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) who was found unresponsive in cell 206-220 in Unit 9 South. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and he was transported by ambulance to a local hospital with CPR still in progress.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Counts
events.description: Routine prison operations including multiple institutional counts, body alarm testing, equipment checks, and inmate transfers between special housing units (e.g., dry cell, psych observation).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (206-220) at 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein at the scene and continued by EMTs during ambulance transport to a local hospital.
The log indicates Epstein was on 'Psych Obs' (psychological observation) with an inmate companion prior to the incident.
The prison's daily operations, including counts and security checks, are documented before and after the medical emergency.
The inmate population count decreased from 758 to 756 over the course of the day, with the SHU (Special Housing Unit) count fluctuating.
